 _ filled her face.

"Give it to me in the morning." I said. My _ was gone. I could hardly stay cool.

Later though,  her gray-blue eyes filled my vision as I thought about how little time we really had until she was grown and gone. My husband asked me what was going on and I told him.
"Maybe she was not asleep yet. Why don't you _ ?" he said.
I followed his advice, _ it was my own idea. I opened her door gently. In Darla's hand I could see her paper all crumpled   up. She had torn into small pieces a big red heart with a poem she had written titled,  "Why I Love My Mother?"
Why I Love My Mother
Although you're busy, and you work so hard,
You always take time to play with me,
I love you Mommy,

Tears filled my eyes. When I softly touched her face,  she awakened from a dreamless sleep and asked,  "Why are you _ ,  Mommy?"
